page.title: 03NEWPORT FIRE STATION
page.content: A Fire Station was constructed on the South Street site in 1939-40 and built by serving Firemen of Newport. It was extended and developed in 1960. It now consists of a full-time,part-time station with{two {pumping appliances, hydraulic {platform, turntable ladder, emergency {tender,foam tender, land-rovers and {assorted vans and back up appliances. There are four watches of men,one watch being on duty all the time and backed up by retained firemen. There is a separate control room which has just had a new computorised system installed. A fire prevention department, headquarters department,training department and workshops.
